results.title: See
results.brief_description:
Off the coast of Sudan, many brilliantly hued creatures live on the coral reefs. Robin Lehman has filmed these creatures - from the translucent to the psychedelic - as they parade in front of the camera.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Secular music of the Renaissance
results.brief_description: David Munroe and the Early English Consort of London present English and Italian secular music of the Renaissance. The instruments, which are introduced before each piece of music, include cornet, sackbut, shawm, crumhorn, cittern, chitarrone and pandora.

results.title: Secrets of the underwater world
results.brief_description: Describes many of the unusual creatures to be found in the shallow seas in the tidal fringe and in fresh water, including the stickleback, diving spider, archer fish, kelpfish, jellyfish, centophere, angler fish, decorator crab, and fiddler crab. Originally released as part of the Disney feature ‘Secrets of life’.

results.title: Secrets of the plant world
results.brief_description: Describes the various ways in which seeds are planted without the help of man. There are seeds which burrow into the ground; some use their own parachutes after being cast afar by a violent explosion of the pod; others twist and gyrate in reaction to sunshine and moisture. Originally released as part of the Disney feature ‘Secrets of life’.

results.title: Secrets of the bee world
results.brief_description: The queen bee is the central figure in the bee world and only she has the power to reproduce the species. The workers build the broad combs in which the honey supply is sealed. Originally released as part of the Disney feature ‘Secrets of life’.

results.title: Secrets of the ant and insect world
results.brief_description: Presents facts about the subterranean world of the ant, including a description of the warfare that persists between rival tribes of ants and their desperate struggle to protect their nests from invasion. Discusses in detail the honey-cask, hunting and leafcutter ants. Origianlly released as part of the Disney feature ‘Secrets of life’.

results.title: Secrets of nature: the nightingale
results.brief_description: Life and characteristics of the nightingale; from North Africa the birds reach woodland districts in southern England in April; comparison of the nightingale and the robin; the song of the birds; nesting sites, type of nest, color of eggs, hatching; feeding the young from the first hatching of eggs until the fledglings leave the nest.

results.title: Secrets of nature: summertime meadow
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Views of typical animal and plant life to be found in an English meadow during summer; ladybirds feeding on aphids; meadow flowers and pollination by bees; snails; grasses and grasshoppers; the looper caterpillar, drinker moth and millipede; swallow-tail butterfly; burnet moths; blue, marbled white, fritillary butterflies; various types of meadow grasses.

results.title: Secrets of nature: starting in life
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The early stages of development of six common forms of life: plants, insects, fish, amphibians, birds, mammals.
